intro: Gyrostachys macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stemmed gyrostachys, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and green spaces.
